cameras.name: Fujifilm X-T4
cameras.description: The Fujifilm X-T4 sports class-leading autofocus, a 26MP APS-C sensor, stellar image processing, 4K video, and a stabilized image sensor. Outside of full-frame models, you won't find a better camera.

cameras.name: Sony A7 III
cameras.description: The Sony a7 III is an entry-level full-frame camera that goes well beyond the basics in features, with excellent image quality, 10fps subject tracking, and 4K video capture.

cameras.name: Canon EOS R6
cameras.description: The EOS R6 is Canon's best mirrorless camera, with a stabilized, full-frame image sensor and an outstanding autofocus system, but video-first creatives will want to look elsewhere.

cameras.name: Sony A6400
cameras.description: The Sony a6400 is a camera that straddles the line between consumer and enthusiast, delivering automatic operation for family snapshots with the image quality and speed aficionados love.

cameras.name: Olympus Tough TG-6
cameras.description: The Olympus Tough TG-6 is a modest update to our favorite underwater point-and-shoot camera thanks to its tough design, bright lens, and excellent macro capabilities.

cameras.name: Nikon D3500
cameras.description: It's as easy to use as a point-and-shoot, but it takes beautiful DSLR photos and videos that get noticed. It feels outstanding in your hands, sturdy and balanced with controls where you want them. It's compact, durable and versatile, ideal for travel.

cameras.name: Canon PowerShot SX70 HS
cameras.description: The Canon PowerShot SX70 HS captures views ranging from ultra-wide to extreme telephoto. It's a solid camera for wildlife observers, families, and shutterbugs in search of a lightweight bridge model.

cameras.name: Canon PowerShot G9 X Mark II
cameras.description: The Canon PowerShot G9 X Mark II camera is more responsive than its predecessor, and squeezes a big 1-inch sensor into a compact frame.

cameras.name: Fujifilm X-T30
cameras.description: The Fujifilm X-T30's dial-based controls are appealing to enthusiasts and pros, and it backs them up with speedy, accurate focus, 4K video, and a strong lens library.

cameras.name: Nikon D850
cameras.description: Around its solid core, this camera is ready for unlimited creativity, with time-lapse shooting, slow-motion video output in Full HD, in-camera Raw processing and a raft of other post-capture adjustments all falling to hand.

cameras.name: Panasonic Lumix GH5
cameras.description: With its 20MP Four Thirds sensor and deep video-centric feature set, it looks likely to pick up where the GH4 left off as a favorite of indie filmmakers and photographers whose interests venture into the realm of motion picture work.

cameras.name: Canon PowerShot SX620 HS
cameras.description: Canon has designed the camera with a svelte body that will still slip inside your pocket without any bother. It's great for those after a basic travel camera thatâ€™s as happy to hone in on far-off details as it will capture sweeping landscapes.
